p: NAC TFs have significant importance in many processes, such as flower growth, cell division, and stress-responsive regulation in the plant due to biotic and abiotic stresses [ 217, 218]. Numerous NAC TFs have been discovered in a wide range of plants with sequenced genomes such as in rice with 151, in Arabidopsis 117 [ 219], in maize 152 [ 220], and in soybean 152 [ 221] NAC TFs have been identified. Additionally, a large number of NAC TFs have been reported to have direct association in abiotic stresses, such as in transgenic Arabidopsis 31 NAC genes, which have been identified for salinity tolerance [ 222], and in rice 40 NAC genes were identified against drought tolerance [ 223]. In sorghum the expression of SbSNAC1 gene was induced by salt and drought stress and over-expression of this gene in transgenic Arabidopsis showed drought resistance [ 224]. Zheng et al. (2009) developed transgenic rice by over-expression of OsNAC045 which conferred drought and salt tolerance [ 225]. Over-expression of OsNAC1 in transgenic rice was studied for salinity and drought tolerance [ 226].
